text: The Theory of Moral Sentiments is a 1759 book by Adam Smith.Letter from David Hume to Adam Smith, 12 April 1759, in Hume, D. (2011) New Letters of David Hume, ed. Raymond Klibansky and Ernest C. Mossner, Oxford: Oxford University Press. p. 49. via Google Books; via Google Books It is the ethical, philosophical, psychological, and methodological ideas of Smith's works, including The Wealth of Nations (1776), Essays on Philosophical Subjects (1795), and Lectures on Justice, Police, Revenue, and Arms (1763) (first published in 1896). == References == Category:1750s books Category:British literature
title: The Theory of Moral Sentiments
